# Canadian Coast Guard National Home Port Analysis

## Description of Request for Proposal

The Canadian Coast Guard (CCG) is seeking proposals from qualified suppliers to conduct an industry analysis of current marine industry crewing best practices, specifically for crew change travel. The primary goal is to recommend options for the CCG that can be managed within the confines of the Government of Canada's National Joint Council's (NJC) travel directive.

## Background

With the introduction of new CCG ships, the CCG anticipates a growth of its seagoing personnel to 130% by 2030. As a result, the CCG requires new crewing options that balance the need for operational readiness and employee flexibility to live where they desire.

## Scope of Work

The selected supplier will be responsible for:

* Conducting research on current marine industry crew change practices
* Comparing best practices with other marine operators to ensure consistency in application and methodology
* Providing recommendations for the CCG to implement a national home port concept that supports operational flexibility and readeriness
* Considering the financial impacts and pros and cons of the national home port concept

## Duration of Contract

The period of the contract will be from the date of contract award to May 17, 2024, inclusive. The resulting contract will include an irrevocable option to extend the contract term by up to one (1) additional year.

## Eligibility Requirements

Only suppliers who hold a Supply Arrangement (SA) under E60ZT-18TSPS and are qualified under Tier 1 for the following category:

* 2.1 Business Analyst (one (1) senior-level resource)

may participate in this solicitation. Suppliers who are not SA-holders must contact PSPC's SA Authority for the TSPS SA to be added for future opportunities.

## Contact Information

For more information, please contact Richard Soulliere, DFO Tenders-Soumissions.MPO@dfo-mpo.gc.ca, (343) 576-2873.

## Solicitation Details

* Solicitation Number: 30004851-001
* Announcement Date: January 10, 2024
* Closing Date: February 5, 2024, 2:00 PM EST
* Expected Contract Start Date: February 9, 2024
* Expected Contract End Date: May 17, 2024
